results.title: NASA Is About to Crash Into an Asteroid. Here’s How to Watch.
results.abstract: The DART mission has been flying to its target since launching last year. On Monday night, it will connect.

results.title: Hurricane Ian Bears Down on Cuba, as Florida Prepares
results.abstract: Cuba was bracing for life-threatening storm surge and evacuations in some western provinces. Hillsborough County, which includes Tampa, issued an evacuation order for low-lying areas.

results.adx_keywords: Renting and Leasing (Real Estate);Real Estate and Housing (Residential);Art;Theater;Lofts;Brooklyn (NYC);Greenpoint (Brooklyn, NY)
results.title: $500 a Month for an Entire Floor in Brooklyn
results.abstract: Jens Rasmussen and Maria Aparo couldn’t walk away from Mr. Rasmussen’s spacious loft in Greenpoint, which is covered under New York’s 1982 Loft Law.

media.caption: “I’m thankful for the loft law — so thankful. Without it, we wouldn’t be able to stay in the city,” said Jens Rasmussen, left, sitting in the apartment he shares with Maria Aparo and their son, Luca.

results.adx_keywords: Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;School Shootings and Armed Attacks;Education (K-12);Deaths (Fatalities);Russia
results.title: At Least 15 Killed in School Shooting in Russia, Including Children
results.abstract: An unidentified gunman entered a school in the city of Izhevsk, killing four adults and 11 children, according to federal investigators.

media.caption: Police and paramedics working at the scene of a shooting at school No. 88 in Izhevsk, Russia, on Monday.

results.title: ‘House of the Dragon,’ Season 1, Episode 6 Recap: A Scandal Spills Over
results.abstract: This week’s episode kicks off the next phase of the story as a long-simmering status quo finally becomes untenable.

media.caption: Another happy arrival: Emma D’Arcy and John Macmillan in “House of the Dragon.”

results.title: More Trans Teens Are Choosing ‘Top Surgery’
results.abstract: Small studies suggest that breast removal surgery improves transgender teenagers’ well-being, but data is sparse. Some state leaders oppose such procedures for minors.
org_facet: World Professional Association for Transgender Health

media.caption: Dr. Sidhbh Gallagher’s unusual embrace of social media platforms like TikTok has made her one of the most visible surgeons in her field.
media.copyright: Eva Marie Uzcategui for The New York Times

results.title: Edward Snowden Is Granted Russian Citizenship
results.abstract: Mr. Snowden, a former intelligence contractor, left the United States after giving hundreds of highly classified N.S.A. documents to The Guardian and The Washington Post in 2013.

media.caption: Edward Snowden speaking during an online forum in Moscow last year.

results.title: Brett Favre’s Most Memorable Stat May Be $8 Million Meant for the Poor
results.abstract: His role in the misappropriation of welfare money has infuriated people in his native Mississippi and prompted some fans to call for his removal from the Hall of Fame.

results.adx_keywords: Elections;Politics and Government;Democracy (Theory and Philosophy);Social Media;Project Democracy;Courts and the Judiciary;Bolsonaro, Jair (1955- );Da Silva, Luiz Inacio Lula;Moraes, Alexandre de (1968- );WhatsApp Inc;Brazil
results.byline: By Jack Nicas and André Spigariol
results.title: To Defend Democracy, Is Brazil’s Top Court Going Too Far?
results.abstract: Brazil’s Supreme Court has acted as the primary check on President Jair Bolsonaro’s power. Now many are worried the court is posing its own threat.

media.caption: Judge Alexandre de Moraes, a member of Brazil’s Supreme Court, has used the court’s power to counter the antidemocratic stances of President Jair Bolsonaro and his supporters.

results.title: Six-Figure Artworks, by a Fifth Grader
results.abstract: Andres Valencia’s paintings have sold for more than $125,000. And he’s 10 years old.

media.caption: Andres Valencia at the Chase Contemporary Gallery in SoHo, where his art was exhibited this summer.
media.copyright: Elliott Jerome Brown Jr. for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Documentary Films and Programs;Terrorism;Muslim Americans;Arab-Americans;Sundance Film Festival (Park City, Utah);Content Type: Personal Profile;Smaker, Meg;Disney, Abigail (1960- )
results.title: Sundance Liked Her Documentary on Terrorism, Until Muslim Critics Didn’t
results.abstract: The film festival gave Meg Smaker’s “Jihad Rehab” a coveted spot in its 2022 lineup, but apologized after an outcry over her race and her approach.

media.caption: After criticism by Arab American and Muslim filmmakers led to the film being shunned by festivals, Meg Smaker renamed her documentary “The UnRedacted.”
media.copyright: Tai Power Seeff for The New York Times

results.title: Whatever Happened to the Starter Home?
results.abstract: The economics of the housing market, and the local rules that shape it, have squeezed out entry-level homes.

results.adx_keywords: Elections, Governors;Midterm Elections (2022);United States Politics and Government;News and News Media;Political Advertising;Campaign Finance;Mastriano, Doug;Shapiro, Josh (1973- );Republican Party;Republican Governors Assn;Pennsylvania;Harrisburg (Pa)
results.title: Mastriano’s Sputtering Campaign: No TV Ads, Tiny Crowds, Little Money
results.abstract: As he runs for governor of Pennsylvania, Doug Mastriano is being heavily outspent by his Democratic rival and trails badly in polling. National Republicans show little desire to help him.

media.caption: Doug Mastriano spoke to a few dozen supporters on Saturday in front of the State Capitol in Harrisburg, Pa. Days before, his running mate, Carrie Lewis DelRosso, had urged supporters to attend “the big rally.”
media.copyright: Mark Makela for The New York Times

results.title: Top State Judges Make a Rare Plea in a Momentous Supreme Court Election Case
results.abstract: In a surprising filing, state chief justices opposed an argument pressed by Republicans — that state legislatures may set federal election rules unconstrained by state constitutions.

media.caption: The Supreme Court is set to hear a case that could radically reshape how federal elections are conducted.
media.copyright: Stefani Reynolds for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Labor and Jobs;Social Media;Research;Privacy;LinkedIn Corporation;Science (Journal);Cornell University;Facebook Inc
results.title: LinkedIn Ran Social Experiments on 20 Million Users Over Five Years
results.abstract: A study that looked back at those tests found that relatively weak social connections were more helpful in finding jobs than stronger social ties.

media.caption: Researchers examined changes that LinkedIn had made to its “People You May Know” algorithm to test what sociologists call the “strength of weak ties.”

results.byline: By Jim Tankersley, Alan Rappeport and Ana Swanson
results.title: Factory Jobs Are Booming Like It’s the 1970s
results.abstract: U.S. manufacturing is experiencing a rebound, with companies adding workers amid high consumer demand for products.

media.caption: A furniture factory in Hickory, N.C. Data suggest the rebound is largely a product of the pandemic recession and recovery.

results.title: Apple Shot an Oscar Contender Starring Will Smith. That Was Before the Slap.
results.abstract: The Civil War drama “Emancipation” finished filming early this year. Now, Apple faces a quandary on what to do with the movie.

media.caption: Will Smith was barred from the Academy Awards ceremony for the next decade after slapping Chris Rock onstage at this year’s awards.

results.title: Giorgia Meloni Wins Voting in Italy, in Breakthrough for Europe’s Hard Right
results.abstract: Her nationalist party was the top vote-getter, leaving Ms. Meloni poised to be Italy’s first female prime minister and the first with post-Fascist roots.

media.caption: Giorgia Meloni at a press conference she gave after early projections had her coalition winning a majority in Parliament, in Rome early Monday.
